resources.string:
<head> 
 <style type="text/css"> 
 .editsection {display: none} 
 #toc {width: 100%} 
 body { font-family: arial } 
 p,ol,li,ul,a {font-size: 12pt } 
 h2 { font-size: 14pt; border-top:1px solid #DBDEE2; padding-top: 10px;
 color: darkblue }
 h3 { font-size: 12pt; color: darkgray }
 </style> 
 </head>

\n **DISCLAIMER** \n The application creator and those affiliated with wikem.org including editors, contributing authors, the Harbor-UCLA EM residency program, and other people and organizations related to this site make this information available without warranties of any kind, express or implied. We disclaim any liability, loss, or damage caused by the contents. If you do not wish to be bound by the foregoing cautions and conditions, please uninstall this app. For full disclaimer please visit wikem.org
WikEM will continue installation and download from wikem.org. It may take a few minutes. While the database loads please read the disclaimer and terms of use of this app.
Thank you for using WikEM. Please wait while WikEM prepares itself for use. \n
WikEM is a collection of internal notes and checklists, passed down from resident to resident in the Harbor-UCLA EM Residency Program for over nearly a decade. For more info visit www.wikem.org

Thank you for using WikEM for Android.
 Please feel free to email feedback to christopherkim.wikem@gmail.com.
 
 Press the search button to get started
Welcome to WikEM Beta for Android. For first time use, you will need to download the WikEM database. For limited data plan, wifi is recommended. In the meantime, please visit wiki.wikem.org
Press Search Button to begin! or feel free to browse through categories

WikEM (wiki + Emergency Medicine) is an open-source-style knowledge management system designed to facilitate dissemination of concise, practical Emergency Medicine knowledge written by an expert community. Medical knowledge traditionally stems from textbooks and practice guidelines whose content is now largely being distributed electronically. The problem with this system within emergency medicine is three-fold. First, the need for costly subscriptions creates access barriers which are exclusive to institutions that can afford them. Second, medical knowledge and practice standards are in a continuous state of flux, rendering the most recent publications (eg. edition of a textbook) obsolete within a few years. Third, it is often necessary in emergency settings that outside knowledge can be easily accessible and distilled to the essentials for patient management.WikEM hopes to overcome these problems with a wiki style database which is adapted to mobile operating systems such as Android.
No Wikem entires added to favorites
Most recent WikEM data downloaded successfully.

pt>function doHighlight(bodyText, searchTerm, highlightStartTag, highlightEndTag) { if ((!highlightStartTag) || (!highlightEndTag)) { highlightStartTag = "<font style='color:blue; background-color:yellow;'>"; highlightEndTag = "</font>"; } var newText = ""; var i = -1; var lcSearchTerm = searchTerm.toLowerCase(); var lcBodyText = bodyText.toLowerCase(); while (bodyText.length > 0) { i = lcBodyText.indexOf(lcSearchTerm, i+1); if (i < 0) { newText += bodyText; bodyText = ""; } else { if (bodyText.lastIndexOf(">", i) >= bodyText.lastIndexOf("<", i)) { if (lcBodyText.lastIndexOf("/script>", i) >= lcBodyText.lastIndexOf("<script", i)) { newText += bodyText.substring(0, i) + highlightStartTag + bodyText.substr(i, searchTerm.length) + highlightEndTag; bodyText = bodyText.substr(i + searchTerm.length); lcBodyText = bodyText.toLowerCase(); i = -1; } } } } return newText; } function searchPrompt(defaultText, treatAsPhrase, textColor, bgColor) { if (!defaultText) { defaultText = ""; } if ((!textColor) || (!bgColor)) { highlightStartTag = ""; highlightEndTag = ""; } else { highlightStartTag = "<font style='color:" + textColor + "; background-color:" + bgColor + ";'>"; highlightEndTag = "</font>"; } if (treatAsPhrase) { promptText = "Please enter the phrase you'd like to search for:"; } else { promptText = "Please enter the words you'd like to search for, separated by spaces:"; } searchText = prompt(promptText, defaultText); if (!searchText) { alert("No search terms were entered. Exiting function."); return false; } return highlightSearchTerms(searchText, treatAsPhrase, true, highlightStartTag, highlightEndTag); } </script>
